intro: Rhinacanthus chiovendae, commonly known as the red root or red root vine, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Bignoniaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America and is characterized by its climbing habit and showy orange to red flowers. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and greenhouses.
